result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Morris Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and elecltronic monitoring.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I  felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must provide letter from probation agent.

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample if not already done.  Pay all costs, surcharges including mandatory DNa surcharge. To bepaid withi n term of probation.  If not paid, a civil jdugment to be entered.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs.
No controled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Same release privileges as above (the imposed and stayed time). To be used by agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Morris Davis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 
days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring. The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Court imposed and STAYED 30 days condition time in the HOC (same release privileges as above), to be used by agent for any violations.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  Must provide letter from probation agent.

Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Kolberg).  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Step Nolten for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Johnny Morris Davis in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
